messageBody:
Thanks, this helped a lot, and also I happen to have the JUnit
Recepies book so I just looked it up. However it looks like that I
will have to run my tests in a container, meaning I have to use
Cactus. I don't think I can do this with Cactus because they
instantiate TestCase. If there is a way I would love to know.

Thanks

Zoran

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> zoran_101 wrote:
>
> > My question is how can I achieve the run of all the 100 test
even if
> > some of them fail.
>
> There is something called the Parameterized Test Case pattern with
> JUnit. The basic idea is to get fixture data into your TestCase
subclass
> through the constructor, then use the suite() method to create a
custom
> test suite with a test for each row of fixture data. For details,
look
> around the web, or in the book _JUnit Recipes_, recipe 4.8.
